title: Calories in Coffee and Creamer
meta_description: Learn calories in coffee and creamer for a standard 8 oz serving with 2 tbsp creamer, plus full nutrition breakdown, macros, and easy tweaks.
assumptions: 8 fl oz (240 ml) brewed black coffee with 2 tbsp (30 ml) liquid non-dairy creamer (e.g., Coffee-mate original); no sugar or additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by coffee brew strength, creamer type/brand, serving size, and additions like sugar. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One 8 oz cup of black coffee with 2 tbsp creamer provides ~72 kcal, primarily from the creamer's fat and sugars.

basis.label: per 1 serving (8 oz coffee + 2 tbsp creamer)

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use 2% milk instead of creamer (2 tbsp)

faqs.q: How many calories in coffee and creamer per cup?
faqs.a: About 72 kcal for 8 oz black coffee with 2 tbsp non-dairy creamer.
Black coffee has negligible calories (~2 kcal per 8 oz), so creamer adds most of the energy.

faqs.q: What if I use heavy cream instead?
faqs.a: Heavy cream (2 tbsp) adds ~100 kcal, making the total ~102 kcal versus non-dairy creamer.

faqs.q: Are there carbs in coffee with creamer?
faqs.a: Yes, ~6 g carbs per serving, mostly sugars from the creamer; black coffee has 0 g.

faqs.q: How does creamer type affect calories?
faqs.a: Non-dairy liquid creamer ~35 kcal/tbsp; powdered ~15 kcal/tsp; fat-free versions ~10 kcal/tbsp.
